content: Which legendary British band's original name was 'The Quarrymen', before they became famous under a different moniker?

I'm pretty sure I know the answer to this one. The legendary British band you're referring to is The Beatles. They started out as The Quarrymen back in the late 1950s when John Lennon and his friends were playing together in Liverpool. Over time, the group evolved, and by 1960, they had changed their name to The Beatles, which was inspired by the name of another band called The Techtones, but with a twist that reflected their love for rock 'n' roll and perhaps a nod to the biblical Beatitudes. The rest, as they say, is history—they went on to become one of the most influential and beloved bands in the world. So, to answer your question directly, The Quarrymen eventually became The Beatles.
